metadata.name: Description
metadata.value: SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.ADDITIVE TECHNICIAN RESPONSIBILITIES:Provides scheduling details, any needed instructional guidance of job assignments, correct procedures and applicable techniques to perform specific skills; ensures accuracy and completionUpdates daily priorities based on input from leadership to ensure team and company goals are metBecomes trained and competent on required tools and equipmentProvides leadership by setting an example, being a model, taking input and deciding how it fits according to our strategic initiativesIdentifies process improvement opportunities and ensures operations are lean, efficient and effectiveFacilitates communication between team members throughout our businessEnsures Additive team members are following SpaceX procedures and stipulations to create a safe environmentStarts additive prints on schedule provided by leadershipPerforms PM’s and machine maintenance autonomouslyMasters all post processing actions from de-powdering to warehouse execution based actions such as splitting tensile coupons and maintaining proper traceabilityMaintains, troubleshoots, calibrates, and repairs equipment and instrumentation as neededFollows all necessary regulations and appropriate SpaceX procedures including quality policies, safety policies, OSHA, EPA, NIOSH, NFPA, ASME, NEC, etc.Performs a variety of related duties including part movements and systematic traceability operations in support of MachiningWorks independently or as part of a team, meets aggressive schedules, provides guidance to team membersBASIC QUALIFICATIONS:High school diploma or equivalency certificate2 years of experience in a manufacturing environment or a fast paced environmentPREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:Understand basic G-Code and comfortable making adjustment to feed/speedAbility to use hand inspection tools to check machined featuresFamiliar with multiple machine control, OSP, Fanuc, and SiemensExperience working with various material, such as Inconel, stainless steel, copper, titaniumAbility to read and work off of a blueprintADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:A good understanding of SAE and metric dimensioningExperience operating fabrication equipment including saws, grinders, sanders, drills, manual and CNC mills and lathesExperience in daily operation, preventive maintenance, and high level troubleshooting of additive manufacturing platformsExperience in a high-volume and/or fast paced environmentGood understanding of facility support systems including compressed air, inert gasses, chilling water, and electricalBasic computer skill, problem solving and decision making skills, and strong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to use ShopFloor, Warehouse Execution, and Work Order DispatchExperience operating EOS and Xline printer platformsCOMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:Pay range:    Additive Technician /Level 1: $20.00 - $27.00/hour    Additive Technician /Level 2: $25.00 - $32.50/hour    Additive Technician /Level 3: $30.00 - $38.00/hour    Your actual level and base salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.Base salary is just one part of your total rewards package at SpaceX. You may also be eligible for long-term incentives, in the form of company stock, stock options, or long-term cash awards, as well as potential discretionary bonuses and the ability to purchase additional stock at a discount through an Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You will also receive access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage, access to a 401(k) retirement plan, short & long-term disability insurance, life insurance, paid parental leave, and various other discounts and perks. You may also accrue 3 weeks of paid vacation & will be eligible for 10 or more paid holidays per year.ITAR REQUIREMENTS:To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C. § 1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C. § 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.  SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX’s Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.

title: Additive Technician (Machining Production)
content:
SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.
ADDITIVE TECHNICIAN (MACHINING PRODUCTION)
RESPONSIBILITIES:

Provides scheduling details, any needed instructional guidance of job assignments, correct procedures and applicable techniques to perform specific skills; ensures accuracy and completion
Updates daily priorities based on input from leadership to ensure team and company goals are met
Becomes trained and competent on required tools and equipment
Provides leadership by setting an example, being a model, taking input and deciding how it fits according to our strategic initiatives
Identifies process improvement opportunities and ensures operations are lean, efficient and effective
Facilitates communication between team members throughout our business
Ensures Additive team members are following SpaceX procedures and stipulations to create a safe environment
Starts additive prints on schedule provided by leadership
Performs PM’s and machine maintenance autonomously
Masters all post processing actions from de-powdering to warehouse execution based actions such as splitting tensile coupons and maintaining proper traceability
Maintains, troubleshoots, calibrates, and repairs equipment and instrumentation as needed
Follows all necessary regulations and appropriate SpaceX procedures including quality policies, safety policies, OSHA, EPA, NIOSH, NFPA, ASME, NEC, etc.
Performs a variety of related duties including part movements and systematic traceability operations in support of Machining
Works independently or as part of a team, meets aggressive schedules, provides guidance to team members

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

High school diploma or equivalency certificate
2+ years of experience in a manufacturing environment

PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Understand basic G-Code and comfortable making adjustment to feed/speed
Ability to use hand inspection tools to check machined features
Familiar with multiple machine control, OSP, Fanuc, and Siemens
Experience working with various material, such as Inconel, stainless steel, copper, titanium
Ability to read and work off of a blueprint

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

A good understanding of SAE and metric dimensioning
Experience operating fabrication equipment including saws, grinders, sanders, drills, manual and CNC mills and lathes
Experience in daily operation, preventive maintenance, and high level troubleshooting of additive manufacturing platforms
Experience in a high-volume and/or fast paced environment
Good understanding of facility support systems including compressed air, inert gasses, chilling water, and electrical
Basic computer skill, problem solving and decision making skills, and strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to use ShopFloor, Warehouse Execution, and Work Order Dispatch
Experience operating EOS and Xline printer platforms

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:
Pay range:    Additive Technician /Level 1: $20.00 - $27.00/hour    Additive Technician /Level 2: $25.00 - $32.50/hour    Additive Technician /Level 3: $30.00 - $38.00/hour    
Your actual level and base salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.
Base salary is just one part of your total rewards package at SpaceX. You may also be eligible for long-term incentives, in the form of company stock, stock options, or long-term cash awards, as well as potential discretionary bonuses and the ability to purchase additional stock at a discount through an Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You will also receive access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage, access to a 401(k) retirement plan, short & long-term disability insurance, life insurance, paid parental leave, and various other discounts and perks. You may also accrue 3 weeks of paid vacation & will be eligible for 10 or more paid holidays per year.
ITAR REQUIREMENTS:

To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C. § 1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C. § 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.  

SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.
Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX’s Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.

compliance.description: <p>PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.</p>

questions.description: To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about ITAR here.
